result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsay M Eilders

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lindsay M Eilders in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Lindsay M Eilders in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1 in 16CM35 and state will move to dismiss and read-in 15CM54.  Atty Gumz agrees.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1 in 16CM35.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  Court questions Atty Gumz.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 in 16CM35.  Court will dismiss and read-in 15CM54.
Counsel make sentencing arguments.  
BY THE COURT:  Court sentences defendant to serve 7 days in the Marquette County Jail, consecutive to any sentence she may now be serving.  *Granted 6 days credit (sentenced to time served).  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample if not already done and pay $200.00 surcharge.
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in May.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he did speak with his client yesterday and she was aware of the hearing.  Atty Gumz is not sure why she is not here today.  Atty Gumz states that the matter is not resolved and requests that this be set for trial.
Atty Hendee requests a warrant and will leave it up to the court to stay that for a couple days.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized; stayed for 48 hours.

Final pre-trial at 12-04-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 01-14-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Lindsay M Eilders in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that there is not an agreement and enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea was previously entered.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court with Student Intern Joshua Andresen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Andresen states that his client did receive the offer and would like a little more time.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.
  Return date scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lindsay M Eilders
Current: 304 Ember Dr, Oxford, WI 53952 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2015)
Prior: W3559 Grouse Av, Pardeeville, WI 53954

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he is working with his client to get an authorization and asks for a little bit of time to get that in.
BY THE COURT: Court will continue to 2:30 calendar.  
Atty Hendee has no objection to continue.

  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.     Attorney Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

with conditions:
No contact with Donovan Simonson or the residence except for one time with Law Enforcement to get her belongings.

Defendant Lindsay M Eilders in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant has no objection to that except for the purpose of picking up and dropping off of her child.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
No contact with Donovan Simonson or the residence except for one time with Law Enforcement to get her belongings.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
